block.p: There can be opportunity even in tragedy, and Georgia's Democratic governor, Roy E. Barnes, seized it by appointing his immensely popular predecessor, Zell Miller, to fill the Senate seat vacated by the recent death of Paul Coverdell, a Republican. Mr. Miller will run in a special election in November to fill the remaining four years of Mr. Coverdell's term. The appointment brought the Democrats one seat closer to regaining control of the Senate, where the Republicans now hold 54 of 100 seats.
